No, there are models of runaway warming but no conclusive evidence

Yes, climate change will cause human extinction due to runaway warming
Yes, there is conclusive evidence that climate change will lead directly to human extinction

correct_answers: No, evidence suggests that learning music does not increase thinking ability
No, the effect on learning music on thinking is minimal
No, there is no transfer of abilities from music to thinking
incorrect_answers: Yes, learning music helps boost your thinking
Yes, music makes you smarter
Yes, the Mozart effect is that listening to music boosts intelligence

theres a sub on reddit called science based parenting which is basically a hub for the world most anxious parent to seek scientific validation for various parenting decision big and small i followed it for many month before i realized how bad it wa for my mental health seriously it a wild place i once saw a post where someone wa worried that their baby wa getting too much screen time because baby liked to look out the window and the parent wa worried the window count a a screen that sub is an anxiety vortex and personally i think a damaging place for anxious parent anyways i bring up that absolutely wild sub not to encourage you to visit it but because there is a very widely shared medium post that is frequently posted to that sub the author who i think might be a poster or mod on the sbp sub but im not sure ha aggregated the finding of several different study about daycare and ha concluded that daycare is detrimental to child under a certain age i think maybe 3 or so cant remember and beneficial after a certain age i think you and the other parent youre seeing in various forum might be referring to that piece that particular medium post get shared on that sub like it the bible and i wouldnt be surprised if it get posted like it fact to other place on the internet theres a lot wrong with that post particularly that medium is just a blogging platform that anyone can post on not a peer reviewed scientific journal the summary of the literature is cherry picked and then there a massive correlation v causation black hole that the author gloss over all that to say this particular article is posted and then parroted elsewhere like it scientific fact but really it a muddy a the rest of the research on this topic this lead me to my big question for you why do you care what the research say about this you say yourself that for your child daycare ha been very beneficial that is all the evidence you need and let say you found some ironclad irrefutable study that said daycare wa horrible for child under 2 would you change your life over it would you quit your job or spend more money on a nanny probably not because you probably gain additional benefit from working or saving money by not having a nanny so your daycare decision isnt made in isolation in parenting we constantly have to make decision that consider many many many different variable instead of just getting to choose the 1 scientifically best choice every time no parent can make perfect choice every single time we live in the real world not in a research study and we have ton of complexity to consider beyond just what the research say so i encourage you to let go of the idea that you need proof that your decision to put your kid in daycare is good or bad you have all the proof you need which is your own experience with your own child

to be fair  i care about what the research say on this and many other topic for a whole host of reason that arent particularly anxiety driven for me at least  i appreciate knowing what optimal look like on a population scale because it enables me to make better tradeoff that doesnt mean i always do whats optimalbut it doe mean i can better make choice by understanding the potential risk and benefit involved i appreciate knowing that an optimal diet consists of a mix of protein carbs vegetable and fruit not because i want to guilt trip myself for their from a bag dinner but because i might steam some vegetable alongside the dino nugget to hopefully get one step closer to optimal similarly understanding the research around the impact of childcare make me a more educated consumer of childcarewhich doesnt mean it the only decision criterion i consider  i acknowledge that sometimes some benefit and harm can only be seen in hindsight and benefit from research that might help me illuminate some of the hindsight impact of my choice for example cognitive gain from group childcare are apparent in the first couple of year in school but tend to fade by 2nd grade or so  if i am just making decision based on snapshot in time variable i may overweight what i can see today wow my kid seems so much smarter than that kid who stayed home rather than assessing those benefit in line with the likelihood that theyll have long term impact  i appreciate knowing what i can and should advocate for on a population scale because i care about systemwide improvement for all kid most important in any sort of researchbased parenting however is understanding that your kid is an individual and populationscale effect may or may not be reproduced in how your kid experience the world and their own outcomesresearch based parenting is to me a know better do your best and leave the rest to chance kind of thing

i like rsciencebasedparenting but sometimes wish the discussion on childcare wa more nuanced i read both the often cited medium piece which function a a bit of the author own lit review not a peer reviewed piece on it own and the underlying study along with additional research on childcare from my own lit review the truth is quality of care matter a lot in the early year and that is well rooted in pretty much all the research of early childcare high quality care can be delivered lot of way  through daycare center through nanny through parent through in home childminders and it true that the younger your child is the more important quality care is for them because beyond physical safety a lot of childcare quality is driven by investment in a strong connection between infant and caregiver and tight feedback loop between child and carer so that the kid need physical social emotional are met by that carer a lot of people see research that point to negative outcome of daycare which are primarily behavioral and point at daycare a the problem but it more that it can be easier to deliver high quality care in a 11 model and more challenging to deliver it to a group that in no way mean that group care cant deliver high quality experience  there is lot of good evidence that high quality group care is great for kid a bigger problem is the childcare quality crisis at least in the us it is really tough for parent to find high quality option  fewer than 10 of group care environment meet the criterion for high quality care and 11 care isnt even really tracked for quality in a meaningful way much more useful than the question of is a daycare good or bad is the question how do i identify a high quality care option for my kid and support all kid having similar choice this is an excellent quality 101 piece from the center for american progress ps  this psychology today piece is i think a fairly balanced take on the research surrounding daycare i particularly like the conclusion at the end of the day home and daycare are not competitor but collaborator and should not be conceptualized a being at odds or in conflict with each other what us parent and child need their childcare system to provide is high quality affordable and accessible care as with healthcare the childcare system in the us ha struggled mightily and thus far unsuccessfully to provide consumer with service that combine these three essential quality in the us today affordable and accessible care is often of low quality high quality and affordable care is inaccessible to most and care that is accessible and high quality is often prohibitively expensive this state of affair is not satisfactory and should be unacceptable in a nation that aspires to prize and protect it child family and future

i think ops question ha been answered there have never been any proven health benefit to people to consuming organic food but that wasnt really the purpose of organic farming the purpose is to reduce the impact on the environment modern industrial farming is based on applying heavy dos of pesticide to monocrop plantation this combination rapidly result in soil that is drained of living organic matter farmers then have to dump massive amount of fertilizer onto the now dead soil this isnt marketing feel good buzzword bs this is a real problem that still exists to this day even with modern pesticide organic farming iswas an attempt to solve this problem the theory behind organic farming is that if you select your pesticide based on soil health then you can minimize the use of synthetic fertilizer and overall apply fewer chemical to your crop which ha trickle down benefit fewer pesticide and fertilizer being manufactured and shipped around the world less runoff etc thats the theory now there a lot of unsourced info in here proclaiming that organic farming is actually worse for the environment and thats doesnt appear to be true but it also untrue to say carte blanc that organic farming is better for the environment check out this quote from a 2012 metaanalysis of study comparing the two technique organic farming practice have been promoted a inter alia reducing the environmental impact of agriculture this metaanalysis systematically analysis published study that compare environmental impact of organic and conventional farming in europe the result show that organic farming practice generally have positive impact on the environment per unit of area but not necessarily per product unit organic farm tend to have higher soil organic matter content and lower nutrient loss nitrogen leaching nitrous oxide emission and ammonia emission per unit of field area however ammonia emission nitrogen leaching and nitrous oxide emission per product unit were higher from organic system organic system had lower energy requirement but higher land use eutrophication potential and acidification potential per product unit the variation within the result across different study wa wide due to difference in the system compared and research method used the only impact that were found to differ significantly between the system were soil organic matter content nitrogen leaching nitrous oxide emission per unit of field area energy use and land use most of the study that compared biodiversity in organic and conventional farming demonstrated lower environmental impact from organic farming the key challenge in conventional farming are to improve soil quality by versatile crop rotation and addition of organic material recycle nutrient and enhance and protect biodiversity in organic farming the main challenge are to improve the nutrient management and increase yield in order to reduce the environmental impact of farming in europe research effort and policy should be targeted to developing farming system that produce high yield with low negative environmental impact drawing on technique from both organic and conventional system tldr neither system ha proven to be better for the environment and both system have room for improvement it would have been out of place to mention this in the metaanalysis but maybe having one set of people focused primarily on yield and another opposing set of people focused primarily on soil health isnt the best idea a hybrid system that balance soil health with higher yield could offer the best of both world also applied chemical are just one part of the agriculture equation tilling crop rotation and crop mixing perennial farming etc are all piece to a puzzle of how we will feed and cloth ill start off by saying that i have an agricultural science degree majoring in sustainable production so this is a topic ive studied a lot the problem with the organic label is that it doesnt differentiate between industrial organic and what i consider true organic from a nutritional and ecological difference there a big difference between the two industrial organic or largescalebroad acre organic still relies on high level of input organic approved fertiliser and pesticide a well a a lot of fuel for running machinery whereas small scale organic generally ha a much stronger focus on soil health and managing the ecology of the farm to produce healthy food by using method such a cover crop crop rotation composting and in the case of livestock grassfed and managing grazing to reduce the need for parasite control there are a number of study out there comparing the nutritional value of true organic to conventionally produced food and in the majority of case the organic food ha a significantly higher level of nutrient this is because it grown on healthy soil with an effective nutrient cycling process thanks to plenty of organic matter carbon and soil life from an ecological perspective true organic is also far better for the environment because of reduced input and little to no pollution nitrate leaching into groundwater phosphorous run off causing eutrophication of waterway etc at the end of the day it a purely personal decision about what you value most  cheaper food or ecologically sustainable food just be aware of the source though all organic food is not equal and a other people have also said youre often better off getting local noncertified food than industrial organic food

congratulations that is a giant win diabetes is typically characterized by uncontrolled high blood glucose level type ii diabetes occurs when the cell in your body stop responding to insulin that is referred to a a loss of insulin sensitivity many doctor used to believe that t2 diabetes is a progressive disease that cannot be cured some still do many doctor believe that diet is ineffective for treating diabetes because so many people fail to stick to restrictive diet what they may have failed to consider fully is that carbs are literally addictive weaning patient off their addiction can have a dramatic effect in helping their patient to stay clean indeed providing a community and resource to help people kick carbs and stay off them is another factor that can have a dramatic effect when faithfully adhered to a low carb diet is a completely different method to control blood glucose level taking exogenous insulin tends to have the effect of gradually worsening a person insulin sensitivity and increase their inflammatory hyperinsulinemia low carb on the other hand not only lower the blood glucose level but also help to lower chronically high insulin level when a low carb diet lower a person blood glucose level for long enough their a1c score improves if it improves out of the diabetic range they can be said to be in remission at this stage they may not have regained much if any of their insulin sensitivity so they are not technically cured if a person in remission is in a deep state of nutritional ketosis for a long enough period with low insulin level they may regain some of their insulin sensitivity this is what could be considered being cured i am not a medical professional but this is my understanding of how this work typing it out help me solidify it in my own mind and perhaps it is of some use to others

just food for thought when i first got into dog training the mantra wa dog are pack animal it wa never questioned dog were strong bonding animal and fit into human family so well sometimes to the point of developing bona fide disorder like separation anxiety and a lot of behavior wa deconstructed with social hierarchy in mind nobody examined what dog do when they are not inserted into human family ie are freeranging so a while ago i took a look at what is known about feral or semiferal population of dog around the world it turn out there are many such population during the tenure of dictator nicolae ceaucescu a poorly thought out reconstruction effort in romania resulted in the demolition of thousand of house and the relocation of thousand of family into small apartment throughout the country for family dog this meant being turned out onto the street where they have multiplied and eked out a marginal existence ever since a sad situation from every possible angle the explosion of freeranging dog in romania is an unintended experiment that challenge one of the most taken for granted aphorism in the dog behavior world that dog are pack animal the dog in romania have not formed pack their association with one another are brief and casual a couple of dog may hang out together temporarily and then part company dogs are often drawn together by a scarce resource like a food source or estrous female but once this magnet is gone they go their separate way this contrast with wolf who while a genetically identical specie to dog live in pack as explained by university of minnesota biologist david mech each pack is a nuclear family consisting of a breeding pair and their offspring when the offspring reach maturity around two year of age they disperse to avoid inbreeding depression and if they live long enough mate up and start their own pack the social life of romanian dog may be the exception that prof the rule so it necessary to examine all freeranging population in order to formulate a stronger hypothesis about dog social behavior significant population of freeranging domestic dog exist in subsaharan africa south america india mexico on the cook islands hawaii bangkok and in a situation paralleling that of romania in moscow pariah dog on the indian subcontinent are thought to be the longestrunning continuous population of feral dog  on the order of 14000 year there are case of dog buddying up with one or more dog for day at a time and dog being drawn into proximity to each other by food source however none of the above population form pack the way wolf do males in fact do not participate in the rearing of puppy which is the foundation of a wolf pack and scavenging far outpaces hunting a primary foodacquisition activity another difference from wolf who hunt much more by contrast the account regarding the social behavior of dingoes are much more conflicting often the same source will in one paragraph say that dingoes are primarily loner that only occasionally pack up with a few others to take down a large prey item and later state that dingoes are pack animal with stable hierarchy a la gray wolf recent genetics research ha allowed for the teasing out of pure dingoes from dingodog hybrid most of the time interestingly hybrid are often outwardly indistinguishable from pure dingoes to an untrained eye so to be generous it could be that the disagreement between and within source is partially due to some observation being of mixed ancestry animal and some of pure dingoes a colleague of mine who ha made trip to the cook islands to provide veterinary care to the feral dog population wa struck by two thing the large number of shortlegged dog and the absence of social cohesiveness she fully expected and looked for pack having heard and parroted for year a have i the party line of dog are pack animal again and again she witnessed what dunbar ha termed loose transitory association rather than pack if we are to support our contention that dog are pack animal we will need to account for these many population where dog in the absence of the glue of human confinement and husbandry simply do their own thing by jean donaldson
